title: Family Medicine in the News
cleaned_text: Since its inception in 2014, the University at Buffalo Human Rights Initiative, a [medical student](/education/md.html) group, has played an important role in helping to document and assess evidence of torture in people seeking refuge and asylum in Western New York. Recently, the group was asked to assist their counterparts in Syracuse and at SUNY Upstate Medical University. [Kim Strong Griswold, MD](http://medicine.buffalo.edu/content/medicine/faculty/profile.html?ubit=griswol) , , group's faculty mentor, gave a virtual talk, "Insights and Best Practices for Medical Evaluations in the Context of Immigration Applications," as part of a panel presentation for potential medical volunteers in Syracuse. "The [Jacobs School](http://medicine.buffalo.edu/) group is an established Physicians for Human Rights clinic," Griswold says.
